title: Habakkuk Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Habakkuk with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 3 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the prophet that received the burden in Habakkuk?
questions.explanation: The book opens stating it is the burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.

questions.question: In Habakkuk 1:2, what does Habakkuk cry unto the LORD about?
questions.explanation: Habakkuk is lamenting the LORD about crying out of violence and not being saved.

questions.question: According to Habakkuk 1:5, how will the people react to the work God will do in their days?
questions.explanation: God says He will work a work which they will not believe, though it be told them.

questions.question: What nation does God say He will raise up in Habakkuk 1:6?
questions.explanation: God says He raises the Chaldeans, a bitter and hasty nation.

questions.question: According to Habakkuk 1:8, the Chaldeans' horsemen shall come from where?
questions.explanation: The horsemen shall come from far, flying as eagles that hasten to eat.

questions.question: What does Habakkuk question about God's justice in Habakkuk 1:13?
options: Why God hides from the people
questions.explanation: He asks why God looks on the treacherous and holds His tongue while the wicked devour the righteous.

questions.question: What do the wicked do according to Habakkuk 1:16?
questions.explanation: The wicked sacrifice unto their net and burn incense unto their drag.

questions.question: What position does Habakkuk say he will take in Habakkuk 2:1?
questions.explanation: Habakkuk says he will stand upon his watch and set himself upon the tower.

questions.question: What command does the LORD give Habakkuk regarding the vision in Habakkuk 2:2?
questions.explanation: God commands to write the vision and make it plain upon tables.

questions.question: According to Habakkuk 2:3, what is true about the vision?
options: It will surely come at the appointed time
questions.correctAnswer: It will surely come at the appointed time
questions.explanation: Though it tarry, wait for it because it will surely come.

questions.question: What does Habakkuk 2:4 say about the just man?
options: He shall live by his faith
questions.correctAnswer: He shall live by his faith
questions.explanation: The just shall live by his faith while the soul that is lifted up is not upright.

questions.question: Who is described as a proud man in Habakkuk 2:5?
options: The man who transgresses by wine
questions.correctAnswer: The man who transgresses by wine
questions.explanation: The proud man transgresses by wine and enlarges his desire as hell.

questions.question: What will rise up suddenly to bite and vex the proud man according to Habakkuk 2:7?
questions.explanation: A parable and taunting proverb will rise up against him suddenly.

questions.question: What shall the remnant of the people do to the spoiler according to Habakkuk 2:8?
questions.explanation: Because he spoiled many nations, the remnant shall spoil him.

questions.question: What is the fate of those who build a city with blood according to Habakkuk 2:12?
questions.explanation: The verse pronounces woe to him that buildeth a city by iniquity.

questions.question: According to Habakkuk 2:14, what will fill the earth?
options: Knowledge of the glory of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge of the glory of the LORD
questions.explanation: The earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD as the waters cover the sea.

questions.question: What is the LORD's position according to Habakkuk 2:20?
questions.explanation: The LORD is in his holy temple; all the earth should keep silence before him.

questions.question: How does Habakkuk describe God's coming in Habakkuk 3:3?
questions.explanation: God came from Teman and the Holy One from mount Paran.

questions.question: What imagery is used in Habakkuk 3:4 to describe God's brightness?
options: Light with horns coming out of his hand
questions.correctAnswer: Light with horns coming out of his hand
questions.explanation: His brightness was as the light; he had horns coming out of his hand.

questions.question: What went before God in Habakkuk 3:5?
questions.explanation: Before him went the pestilence, and burning coals went forth at his feet.

questions.question: What did the mountains and hills do when God measured the earth according to Habakkuk 3:6?
questions.explanation: Everlasting mountains were scattered, perpetual hills bowed.

questions.question: Which places' tents and curtains did Habakkuk see in affliction in Habakkuk 3:7?
questions.explanation: He saw the tents of Cushan in affliction and the curtains of Midian trembling.

questions.question: What question does Habakkuk ask about the rivers in Habakkuk 3:8?
options: Was the LORD displeased against the rivers?
questions.correctAnswer: Was the LORD displeased against the rivers?
questions.explanation: He asks if God's anger was against the rivers that he rode upon horses and chariots of salvation.

questions.question: According to Habakkuk 3:9, what was God’s bow described as?
questions.explanation: The bow was made quite naked, according to the oaths of the tribes.

questions.question: What natural event caused the mountains to tremble in Habakkuk 3:10?
questions.explanation: The mountains saw God and trembled; the overflowing of the water passed by.

questions.question: What stood still in their habitation in Habakkuk 3:11?
questions.explanation: The sun and moon stood still in their habitation at the light of God's arrows.

questions.question: What did God do to the heathen in His indignation in Habakkuk 3:12?
questions.explanation: God marched in indignation and threshed the heathen in anger.

questions.question: In Habakkuk 3:13, whose head was wounded by God’s anointed?
questions.explanation: God wounded the head out of the house of the wicked.

questions.question: According to Habakkuk 3:15, how did God walk through the sea?
questions.explanation: God walked through the sea with horses through the heap of great waters.

questions.question: What physical reaction did Habakkuk experience upon hearing in Habakkuk 3:16?
questions.explanation: Habakkuk's belly trembled, lips quivered, and he trembled in himself.

questions.question: What will happen if the fig tree does not blossom according to Habakkuk 3:17?
options: The speaker will still rejoice in the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: The speaker will still rejoice in the LORD
questions.explanation: Though the fig tree shall not blossom, the speaker will still rejoice in the LORD.

questions.question: What does Habakkuk say the LORD God will make his feet like in Habakkuk 3:19?
questions.explanation: The LORD God will make his feet like hinds' feet to walk upon high places.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Habakkuk 1:4: 'Therefore the law is ________, and judgment doth never go forth.'
questions.explanation: The verse says the law is slacked, meaning weakened or neglected.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Habakkuk 2:4: 'Behold, his soul which is lifted up is not upright in him: but the just shall live by his ______.'
questions.explanation: The just shall live by his faith, emphasizing trust in God.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Habakkuk 2:20: 'But the LORD is in his holy ______: let all the earth keep silence before him.'
questions.explanation: The LORD is in his holy temple, a place of reverence.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Habakkuk 3:18: 'Yet I will rejoice in the LORD, I will joy in the God of my ______.'
questions.explanation: The verse concludes with joy in the God of salvation.

questions.question: True or False: Habakkuk 1:6 describes the Chaldeans as a slow and gentle nation.
questions.explanation: The Chaldeans are described as bitter and hasty, not slow and gentle.

questions.question: True or False: Habakkuk 1:13 says God has eyes too pure to look on evil.
questions.explanation: God is described as being of purer eyes than to behold evil.

questions.question: True or False: In Habakkuk 2:3, the vision will lie and not come to pass.
questions.explanation: The vision will not lie; it will surely come at the appointed time.

questions.question: True or False: Habakkuk 2:14 teaches that the earth will be covered with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD as the waters cover the sea.
questions.explanation: This verse declares the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the LORD's glory.

questions.question: True or False: Habakkuk 3:3 says God came from Babylon with great power.
questions.explanation: God is said to come from Teman and mount Paran, not Babylon.

questions.question: True or False: Habakkuk 3:11 describes the sun and moon standing still at the light of God's arrows.
questions.explanation: The sun and moon stood still in their habitation at God's arrows' light.

questions.question: True or False: Habakkuk 3:17 says the fig tree will blossom and the fields will yield much meat.
questions.explanation: The verse says the fig tree shall not blossom and the fields shall yield no meat.

questions.question: True or False: Habakkuk 1:4 states that judgment doth never go forth because the wicked compass about the righteous.
questions.explanation: The law is slacked and judgment does not go forth because the wicked surround the righteous.

questions.question: True or False: Habakkuk 2:8 says the remnant of the people shall spoil the one who spoiled many nations.
questions.explanation: Because of his violence, the remnant will spoil him in return.
